intro: Coronilla minima subsp. vigoi, commonly known as the small crown vetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of about 10–30 centimeters. The plant features trifoliate leaves and produces small, yellowish-white flowers in clusters. It is native to southern Europe and is often found in dry, rocky soils. Due to its ability to fix nitrogen, it is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
